definition: Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: Comparison method, which measures the metal specific heat capacity in accordance with Newton's law of cooling.
sentences.chinese: 用比較方法，根據牛頓冷卻定律測定金屬的比熱容。

sentences.english: What is the specific heat of the metal in the pan?
sentences.chinese: 這隻鍋的金屬的比熱容是多少？

sentences.english: There is nothing better than a hot dog in the country.
sentences.chinese: 在美國鄉村沒有比熱狗更好的東西了。

sentences.english: Ice is only half the specific heat of water.
sentences.chinese: 冰的比熱只有水的一半。

sentences.english: Both this theorem and the unattainability of absolute zero can't be derived from each other.
sentences.chinese: 但能氏定理與比熱隨正絕對溫度趨於零則可互推。

sentences.english: T It's Cp dT over T at constant pressure.
Cold borscht is much thinner than hot borscht and is almost always vegetarian.
sentences.chinese: 冷羅宋湯比熱羅宋湯更清淡，而且幾乎只有蔬菜。

definition: success across the board/victory in everything one touches
to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
to steal the show/to grab the limelight
